Automatic Recovery Error Dialog Box

Requires: Base Development System

This dialog box appears when LabVIEW encounters an error and cannot recover automatically saved files.

Consider the following potential causes for this error:

  • The original files on disk are set to read-only.
  • You do not have write permission for the original files on disk.

This dialog box includes the following components:

  • Errors Directory—Displays the directory that contains the backup files that LabVIEW could not recover.
  • Delete Backup Files—Deletes the automatically saved files that LabVIEW could not recover and continues launching LabVIEW.
    If you choose this option, LabVIEW deletes autosaved files. You can recover autosaved files by copying the files to a safe location before you continue working.
